UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile within the Verdant Day application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

registrationDate.description: Date and time the user registered.

bedtime.description: User's typical bedtime in HH:mm format.

wakeUpTime.description: User's typical wake-up time in HH:mm format.

TodoItem.title: TodoItem
TodoItem.description: Represents a to-do item in a user's list.

id.description: Unique identifier for the to-do item.

text.description: The text description of the to-do item.

dueDate.description: The due date and time for the to-do item.

completed.description: Indicates whether the to-do item has been completed.

CalendarEvent.title: CalendarEvent
CalendarEvent.description: Represents an event in the user's calendar.

id.description: Unique identifier for the calendar event.

title.description: The title of the calendar event.

description.description: A more detailed description of the event.

startTime.description: The start date and time of the event.

endTime.description: The end date and time of the event.

recurringRule.description: A string representing the recurring rule of the event (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly, or specific days of the week).  Uses iCalendar RRULE format

SleepData.title: SleepData
SleepData.description: Represents sleep data collected and analyzed for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the sleep data entry.

bedtime.description: The time the user went to bed.

wakeUpTime.description: The time the user woke up.

sleepQuality.description: A score or metric representing the quality of sleep.

date.description: The date for which the sleep data is recorded.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to provide a secure, scalable, and maintainable backend for the Verdant Day application, focusing on user-specific data and collaborative features. The primary goal is to ensure authorization independence, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules by denormalizing authorization-related data. This structure also supports secure `list` operations by segregating data based on ownership and access control.

**Data Segregation and Ownership:**

*   User profiles are stored under `/users/{userId}`, ensuring that only the authenticated user can access their profile data. This path-based ownership simplifies security rules.
*   Todo items, calendar events, and sleep data are stored as subcollections under each user's profile (`/users/{userId}/todos/{todoId}`, `/users/{userId}/calendarEvents/{calendarEventId}`, and `/users/{userId}/sleepData/{sleepDataId}`). This establishes a clear 1:N relationship, providing straightforward ownership and simplifying security rules.

**Authorization Independence:**

*   Since all data is private and user-owned, no denormalization is needed.

**QAPs (Rules Are Not Filters):**

*   The structure enables secure `list` operations because data is segregated by user ID. Security rules can efficiently check `request.auth.uid == userId` to authorize listing operations within a user's collection.

**Scalability and Maintainability:**

*   The design promotes scalability by avoiding complex queries and nested `get()` calls. Security rules are simple and efficient, leading to better performance.
*   The clear structure and naming conventions enhance maintainability, making it easier to understand and modify the security rules and data model.

**Addressing Specific Requirements:**

*   **User Account Persistence**: User profiles are stored to persist user data across sessions.
*   **History Tracking**: Storing tasks and events allows for history tracking within the user's data.
*   **Recurring Events**: The inclusion of `recurringRule` field in the calendar schema addresses the need for recurring events.
